Changing Chart Element Patterns

Note: This topic applies to charting in the Windows client only.

Depending upon the chart, you can change the pattern used for:

  • Bars, in bar charts.

  • Points, in charts with points.

  • Areas, in area charts.

  • Slices, in pie and doughnut charts. Each slice is considered a series. If you give one slice a pattern, each of the other slices automatically receives a pattern.

If you feel limited by the current selection of patterns, you can even design your own.

To change the patterns of non-text chart elements:

  1. If the Pattern Bar is not already displayed, click the Tools button on the Chart window toolbar. Then select PatternBar from the menu.

  2. If the window is not wide enough to display the complete Pattern Bar, use the arrows to scroll through the patterns.

  3. From the Pattern Bar, drag a pattern to a chart element. This action applies the pattern to the chart element.

To design a custom pattern:

  1. If the Pattern Bar is not already displayed, click the Tools button on the Chart window toolbar. Then select PatternBar from the menu.

  2. If the window is not wide enough to display the complete Pattern Bar, use the arrows to scroll through the patterns.

  3. Select a pattern that you wish to replace and double-click. The Pattern Editor displays the 8-by-8 pixel pattern in a grid.

  4. Redesign the pattern by clicking squares in the grid. Each square you click changes its color from white to black or vice versa. The Sample box shows how the new pattern will look.

  5. When you have designed a satisfactory pattern, click OK.
